Given the constraints of time management and estimation, watching all 221 episodes of "JAG" in six months is feasible. Assuming each episode is approximately 45 minutes long, the total viewing time required is:

\[ 221 \text{ episodes} \times 45 \text{ minutes/episode} = 9945 \text{ minutes} \]

Converting this to hours:

\[ \frac{9945 \text{ minutes}}{60 \text{ minutes/hour}} = 165.75 \text{ hours} \]

Over a six-month period, assuming 180 days, the daily viewing time required is:

\[ \frac{165.75 \text{ hours}}{180 \text{ days}} \approx 0.92 \text{ hours/day} \]

This translates to approximately 55 minutes per day, which is a manageable and realistic time commitment. Therefore, with a consistent daily viewing schedule, it is indeed possible to watch all of "JAG" in six months.
